title: Migration crisis as hundreds stranded at Peru-Chile border
description: A migration crisis at the border between Chile and Peru is intensifying, with hundreds of people stranded, unable to cross into Peru in an effort to return to their home country of Venezuela

title: Migration crisis: Hundreds stranded at Peru-Chile border
description: A migration crisis at the border between Chile and Peru is intensifying, with hundreds of people stranded, unable to cross into Peru in an effort to return to their home country of Venezuela

title: Shakespeare tale scoops nonfiction 'winner of winners' prize
description: An account of a pivotal year for English history and literature has been named the greatest-ever winner of the U.K.’s leading nonfiction book prize

title: King's Champion, orb-bearer: Palace unveils coronation roles
description: Buckingham Palace has announced more than two dozen ceremonial roles at King Charles III’s coronation as organizers seek to ground the event in tradition while also ensuring that it reflects modern Britain

title: Police release details on Canada stabbings that left 11 dead
description: Canadian police have released details about a stabbing rampage that left 11 people dead and 17 injured inside and around the James Smith Cree Nation on Sept. 4, but said they may never know why the assailant went on the killing spree

title: Police release details on Canada stabbings that left 11 dead
description: Canadian police have released details about a stabbing rampage that left 11 people dead and 17 injured inside and around the James Smith Cree Nation on Sept. 4, but said they may never know why the assailant went on the killing spree

title: People fleeing Sudan recount stories of fear and violence on the road
description: Thousands of people have streamed to Sudan’s international borders over the past two weeks. Here are four of their stories.

title: Who is alleged Russian spy Sergey Cherkasov?
description: His name has been mentioned as a potential prisoner swap with Russia for U.S. citizens like journalist Evan Gershkovich and U.S. Marine Paul Whelan.

title: US sanctions Mexican resort timeshare fraud linked to cartel
description: The U.S. Treasury Department has announced sanctions against members of the Jalisco New Generation drug cartel who apparently went into a side business of timeshare fraud that allegedly targeted elderly Americans

title: Pace of U.S. tank delivery to Ukraine draws fire in Senate
description: Sen. Tom Cotton took aim at President Biden, while Sen. Angus King bemoaned what he called "the longest windup for a punch in the history of the world."

title: Tom of Finland exhibit celebrates Nordic country's gay icon
description: A new exhibition showing the works of Touko Laaksonen, better known by his pseudonym Tom of Finland, adds a personal touch to the late Finnish artist whose homoerotic drawings of muscular men gained a following in the gay community from the 1950s

title: U.S. asks Brazil to extradite alleged Russian spy who posed as student
description: The United States wants to take custody of alleged Russian operative Sergey Cherkasov while Moscow is pursuing its own extradition request accusing him of being a heroin trafficker.

title: Israeli army kills alleged Palestinian attacker in West Bank
description: Authorities say Israeli security forces have shot and killed a suspected Palestinian assailant in the West Bank

title: Spain bans 'dwarf bullfighting'
description: Spain’s parliament bans “comic” bullfighting events featuring dwarves dressed in costume, in a decision applauded by disability rights groups but condemned by the few surviving performers

title: Group: Turkish troops shooting Syrian civilians along border
description: An international human rights group says Turkish border guards have been indiscriminately shooting at Syrian civilians along the border with the war-wrecked country, as well as using excessive force against asylum seekers and migrants trying to cross into Turkey

title: Another Kenyan pastor arrested over deaths of followers
description: Police in Kenya have arrested another popular pastor and closed his church on the Indian Ocean coast as the number of deaths linked to a cult in the area rose to 103

title: U.S. to open immigrant processing centers in Latin America
description: Border Patrol facilities are stretched to capacity by a surge of migrants. It's a bad sign for President Biden's plan to lift pandemic-era restrictions May 11.

title: Foundation prints 3D prosthetics, gives them free in Uruguay
description: The first thing 11-year-old Mia Rodr�guez did with her new prosthetic hands was draw a picture of a kitten

title: Missing yacht with 3 Russians, 2 Egyptians reaches safety
description: A missing yacht with three Russians and two Egyptians onboard has reached safety in Djibouti in east Africa, after going missing for days following a reported attack off the coast of Yemen

title: Firearms official, gun club probed over Hamburg shooting
description: German prosecutors say they are investigating an official at Hamburg’s firearms department and three members of a gun club in connection with a mass shooting at a Jehovah’s Witness hall last month

title: Asylum-seeking ex-member of Wagner Group sentenced in Norway
description: A court in Norway has sentenced a former contractor of Russian military company the Wagner Group to 14 days in jail for disorderly conduct and for carrying an air gun in a public place

title: On frontier of new ‘gold rush,’ quest for coveted EV metals yields misery
description: The soaring demand for electric vehicles is fueling dramatic changes in Guinea, home to the world’s largest bauxite reserves.

title: The underbelly of electric vehicles
description: Mining and processing the minerals needed to meet the growing demand for EVs can be costly for workers, local communities and the environment.

title: Man held over German gym attack suspected in earlier killing
description: Prosecutors say a man arrested over last week’s stabbing attack at a gym in western Germany in which four people were wounded is now also a suspect in a fatal stabbing earlier this month

title: Refurbished Chopin museum reopens in Warsaw with new items
description: A museum to Polish pianist and composer Frederic Chopin reopens in Warsaw this week after months of renovations

title: Church of England: There’s nothing wrong with being single. Jesus was, too.
description: “The Church of England celebrates singleness and does not regard it as lesser than living in a couple relationship,” a church report says.

title: The Netherlands celebrates birthday of King Willem-Alexander
description: The Netherlands is celebrating the 56th birthday of King Willem-Alexander with street markets, parties and orange-glazed pastries, even as an annual poll shows support for the monarchy continuing to decline

title: Analysis: China's Ukraine plan mixes peace, self-interest
description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping’s plan to send an envoy to Ukraine allows his government to deflect criticism of its support for Moscow and pursue a bigger role as a diplomatic force, but Xi faces daunting obstacles if he is serious about trying to help end the 14-month-old war

title: Iran urges Lebanese sides to reach agreement over president
description: Iran’s foreign minister says Tehran wants Lebanon’s rivals to reach an agreement to elect a new president in the crisis-hit country that has been without a head of state October

title: China welcomes Ya Ya the panda home after 20 years abroad
description: Ya Ya the giant panda has landed in Shanghai after spending the past 20 years in the Memphis Zoo in Tennessee on loan

title: Florida Gov. DeSantis says Disney lawsuit is political
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis is brushing off Disney’s lawsuit against him as politically motivated and says it’s time for the iconic company to stop getting favorable treatment in his state

title: U.S. indictments trace fentanyl supply lines from China to Mexico
description: But experts say there’s little chance the Chinese chemical companies that sell ingredients to Mexican cartels will be prosecuted.

title: Spain swelters in temperatures more typical of summer
description: Spain’s national weather service says temperatures are set to “reach values typical of summer” across most of the country

title: Reported fighting in Sudan's Darfur mars fragile truce
description: Residents say fighting has intensified in Sudan’s war-ravaged province of Darfur during a fragile three-day truce between the country’s battling top generals

title: 7 killed in fire on passenger train in southern Pakistan
description: Officials say seven people were killed when a passenger train caught fire in southern Pakistan

title: DeSantis speaks in Israel amid political turmoil
description: The Florida governor is in Jerusalem for his highest-profile platform yet to discuss foreign affairs ahead of a 2024 presidential campaign.

title: 2 killed in fire on passenger train in southern Pakistan
description: Officials say two people were killed and four children were missing when a passenger train caught fire in southern Pakistan

title: Women can vote for first time at key meeting for Catholics, pope rules
description: There will be a significant change at this year's Synod of Bishops, the key body guiding Vatican policy: Female Catholics and other non-bishops will cast votes.

title: Ukraine live briefing: China to send senior diplomat to Kyiv; Russia can fund war another year, documents say
description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping had his first call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky since the war began. Beijing will send a special representative to Kyiv.

title: King's coronation part of long evolution for Queen Camilla
description: Britain’s queen consort, Camilla, has come a long way

title: Bank: Asia must quit coal faster to stem worst climate woes
description: Asia must rapidly cut fossil fuel subsidies and plow more money into a clean energy transition to avoid catastrophic climate change that puts its own development at risk

title: 15 years on, final video of journalist slain in Myanmar comes to light
description: Japanese reporter Kenji Nagai was killed as soldiers fired on demonstrators protesting the military junta. An image of his last moments won a Pulitzer Prize.

title: Scientists: Climate change worsened Eastern Africa drought
description: An international team of climate scientists says the ongoing drought in Eastern Africa has been made worse by human-induced climate change

title: Russia needs more troops but is wary of public anger, leaked documents say
description: As the war in Ukraine drags on, Putin’s military commanders urgently need more troops but Russian officials are wary of public anger, according to leaked documents.

title: Climate change caused catastrophic East Africa drought, scientists say
description: A new analysis of the region's worst drought in 40 years said the crisis would not have happened in a cooler world.

title: The Ukraine-China relationship is a balancing act for both parties
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky spoke with Chinese President Xi Jinping via phone on Wednesday — their first conversation since Russia invaded Ukraine.
